theory_synthesis.description: Interhemispheric working-memory transfer is coordinated by band-specific field synchrony (theta and high-beta) that transiently aligns timing between hemispheres to route information. Such structured field dynamics provide a mechanism for stitching distributed neural representations into unified contents over relevant integration windows.

supported_claims.description: Array of claim numbers that are best supported by evidence in this paper

13.claim_text: Spatially organized extracellular EM fields emerge from coordinated neuronal activity.

direct_quotes.quote: Around the time of transfer, synchrony between the two prefrontal hemispheres peaked in theta and beta frequencies, with a directionality consistent with memory trace transfer.
Thus, we measured oscillatory synchrony between LFPs in the two prefrontal hemispheres using pairwise phase consistency (PPC), an unbiased measure of phase synchrony.
direct_quotes.page_or_section: Results – Interhemispheric synchrony during memory transfer

direct_quotes.quote: Around the saccade on swap trials—when WM trace transfer putatively occurs—interhemispheric theta (~4–10 Hz) and high-beta (~18–40 Hz) synchrony both exhibited a transient peak...
direct_quotes.page_or_section: Results – Interhemispheric synchrony during memory transfer

13.interpretation: Interhemispheric LFP phase synchrony indicates coordinated mesoscopic EM field organization arising from population activity; the transient, frequency-specific coupling reflects emergent field structure during active information routing.
13.limitations: LFP synchrony is an indirect proxy for EM field structure and does not map spatial field topology explicitly; no forward modeling of field configurations was performed.

15.claim_text: Coherent EM gradients across cortical and subcortical regions facilitate large-scale signal integration.

direct_quotes.quote: This illustrates how dynamics between the two cortical hemispheres can stitch together WM traces across visual hemifields.
These results suggest evidence for interhemispheric signal communication underlying memory trace transfer and that communication occurs via theta and high-beta but not alpha/beta synchrony.
direct_quotes.page_or_section: Results – Interhemispheric synchrony during memory transfer

15.interpretation: Band-specific interhemispheric synchrony provides a mechanism for large-scale integration, aligning neural dynamics across hemispheres to combine and route information necessary for unified working-memory representations.
15.limitations: Integration was demonstrated between bilateral PFC rather than across broader cortical–subcortical networks; causal necessity of synchrony for integration was not tested.

22.claim_text: Structured EM fields facilitate long-range timing alignment beyond direct synaptic connectivity.

direct_quotes.quote: Evidence suggests that phase synchrony between cortical areas helps regulate the flow of information (Fries, 2015). Thus, we measured oscillatory synchrony...
direct_quotes.page_or_section: Results – Interhemispheric synchrony during memory transfer

direct_quotes.quote: Interhemispheric theta (~4–10 Hz) and high-beta (~18–40 Hz) synchrony both exhibited a transient peak...
direct_quotes.page_or_section: Results – Interhemispheric synchrony during memory transfer

direct_quotes.quote: As predicted, causality was greater in the sender-to-receiver direction... it was greatest at the same high-beta frequencies that synchrony peaked at (~20–40 Hz).

22.interpretation: Transient theta/high-beta phase alignment across hemispheres temporally coordinates sender and receiver circuits to route WM traces; the directed Granger asymmetry at these bands indicates timing alignment that supports functional coupling over long distances.
22.limitations: While synchrony aligns timing, interhemispheric transfer likely also relies on corpus callosum synapses; the study does not isolate field-mediated effects from synaptic pathways or demonstrate effects beyond anatomical connectivity.

49.claim_text: Information-theoretic analyses (Granger, transfer entropy) can identify directionality of conscious content flow distinct from raw coherence.

direct_quotes.quote: To test whether signals flow from the sender to the receiver hemisphere, we measured spectral Granger causality between LFPs in the two prefrontal hemispheres.
As predicted, causality was greater in the sender-to-receiver direction... significant for all frequencies from approximately 10–40 Hz...
We recomputed Granger causality on time-reversed data... This is exactly what we observed.

49.interpretation: Spectral Granger analysis revealed directed sender→receiver information flow during WM transfer, providing directional insight beyond undirected synchrony measures and validating causality with time-reversal controls.
49.limitations: The paradigm addresses working-memory transfer rather than explicit conscious access reports; transfer entropy was not applied, and directionality was examined only between bilateral PFC.

16.claim_text: Cross-frequency nesting within EM fields couples slow oscillations to faster local synchrony.

direct_quotes.quote: Gamma and alpha/beta oscillations have characteristic WM-related temporal dynamics... We replicated these anti-correlated gamma/beta dynamics both when a WM is statically maintained, and when it is transferred between hemispheres.
We found that theta dynamics also broadly correlate with gamma and anti-correlate with alpha/beta.

16.interpretation: The coordinated relationships among theta, beta, and gamma during encoding, maintenance, and transfer imply cross-frequency interactions that could implement coupling between slower coordinating rhythms and faster local processes.
16.limitations: The study did not quantify phase–amplitude coupling or nesting; relationships are described as correlational dynamics rather than explicit cross-frequency coupling metrics.

additional_or_contradictory_insights.finding: Transferred memories initially engage different neural ensembles than feedforward-induced traces, with partial convergence just before readout.
quotes: Transferred traces initially used different neural ensembles from feedforward-induced ones, but they converged at the end of the delay.
These results mostly support the novel ensemble model... However, near the end of the delay, the cross-classification of contralateral-shift trials increased...
additional_or_contradictory_insights.relevance: Indicates that routing path shapes representational codes, suggesting dynamic remapping before decision readout that theories should accommodate.

additional_or_contradictory_insights.finding: Interhemispheric transfer proceeds via a "soft handoff" with overlapping representation across hemispheres.
quotes: Interhemispheric transfer in this task thus involves a "soft handoff," in which information overlaps in time in both hemispheres before being cleared out of the sending hemisphere.
additional_or_contradictory_insights.relevance: Supports integration windows wherein multiple regions jointly maintain content, relevant for models of transient unified content.

additional_or_contradictory_insights.finding: Synchronization between hemispheres at traditional gamma frequencies was absent; coupling was prominent in theta and high-beta, with alpha/low-beta suppression.
quotes: We also found similar dynamics... between hemispheres, with the exception that synchronization between hemispheres at traditional gamma frequencies was absent.
Our results showed increases in interhemispheric theta and high-beta synchrony, and decreases in alpha/low-beta, during the presumed time of memory trace transfer.
additional_or_contradictory_insights.relevance: Suggests long-range coordination may preferentially use sub-gamma bands, potentially due to conduction delays; informs which frequencies to target for inter-areal timing alignment.

additional_or_contradictory_insights.finding: WM appears spatiotopic at the cognitive level but retinotopic in neural implementation, necessitating interhemispheric remapping after saccades.
quotes: Our results are consistent with the remembered location’s being maintained within a spatiotopic reference frame at the cognitive level... but within a retinotopic reference frame at the neural level.
They suggest that... the two prefrontal hemispheres briefly sync up using theta and beta oscillations in order to physically transfer a WM trace...
additional_or_contradictory_insights.relevance: Highlights a mechanism by which rhythmic coupling supports reference-frame updating, relevant for continuity of conscious content across eye movements.
